title: Ghaznavids
summary: The Ghaznavid dynasty (Persian: غزنویان‎ Ġaznaviyān) was a Persianate[7] Muslim dynasty of Turkic mamluk origin,[8][lower-alpha 2][9] ruling, at its greatest extent, large parts of Iran, Afghanistan, much of Transoxiana and the northwest Indian subcontinent from 977 to 1186.[10] The dynasty was founded by Sabuktigin upon his succession to the rule of Ghazna after the death of his father-in-law, Alp Tigin, who was an ex-general of the Samanid Empire from Balkh, north of the Hindu Kush in Greater Khorasan.
